title: There was an unexpected error with the login session. Please try again.
body:
On my desktop computer when I launch League of Legends the client stays in a black screen until this error pops up.

The error only occurs when I am connected to my router with ethernet.

I can bypass the error by using a VPN combined with my ethernet cable OR I use my motherboards wi-fi.

If I plug an ethernet cable into my laptop and launch the game it replicates the same error.

Are there any settings I should know about in a router that would cause this? I haven't been able to play for over 2-3 years now.

Edit: Sorry I should have mentioned I have spoken with support and they have no idea. Looking for someone who has troubleshot the issue on their own.

replies.body:
Try modifying ur firewall level to low.
Or have you updated ur computer these days? Specifically, last night?
If yes, reset your computer to the preview version, and everything will be all right!!!!

How very strange. I run the game on ethernet as well and have had no drama... Perhaps some more information would help:

1. When did you first start seeing this issue?
2. PC or Mac?
3. Is your OS up to date?
4. Have you been able to try your laptop on someone else's ethernet? (And if yes, what were the results?)
5. What router do you have?
6. Are there any switches or other connections between you and it?
7. Have you tried different ports on your router?

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=Latr5XUk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-11-04T09:54:23.682+0000)
>
> How very strange. I run the game on ethernet as well and have had no drama... Perhaps some more information would help:
> 
> 1. When did you first start seeing this issue?
> 2. PC or Mac?
> 3. Is your OS up to date?
> 4. Have you been able to try your laptop on someone else's ethernet? (And if yes, what were the results?)
> 5. What router do you have?
> 6. Are there any switches or other connections between you and it?
> 7. Have you tried different ports on your router?

1. Too long ago
2. PC
3. Definitely
4. One of the only things I haven't been able to do.
5. Asus rt-ac68u
6. Hardwired straight into the router.
7. All of them.

A VPN connection to anywhere fixes my issue even when using ethernet as well so I'm lost lol.

Hmm, it seems likely it's something specific to the router.

Some things you can try:

1. If it's possible, try briefly disabling the ASUS AIProtection temporarily and see if that changes anything.
2. Make sure your router firmware (and software if it has it) is up to date.
3. Have a dig through your router's settings and see if there's anything in the realm of firewall type stuff that might be blocking some connections.
4. Have a dig through your firewall settings and make sure there aren't any weird blocks on any LoL processes that might prevent them from connecting via ethernet.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=Latr5XUk,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-04T13:11:28.234+0000)
>
> Hmm, it seems likely it's something specific to the router.
> 
> Some things you can try:
> 
> 1. If it's possible, try briefly disabling the ASUS AIProtection temporarily and see if that changes anything.
> 2. Make sure your router firmware (and software if it has it) is up to date.
> 3. Have a dig through your router's settings and see if there's anything in the realm of firewall type stuff that might be blocking some connections.
> 4. Have a dig through your firewall settings and make sure there aren't any weird blocks on any LoL processes that might prevent them from connecting via ethernet.

AIProt has never been active and I still can't connect to the servers with the routers firewall down and my PC in a DMZ. So lost. It's most likely router issue but I don't know of any settings interfering with a wired-only connection.
I'm afraid that's the end of my knowledge. Other than talking to ASUS support I'm not sure what else there is to try other than the rather drastic measure of buying a new router.
